name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 1,4-dione ring with a pyridine ring linked in place of a hydrogen atom. The pyridine ring itself has a melting point around 106°C due to the presence of a nitrogen atom, which enhances the crystalline structure and the molecular weight. The methylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The naphthalene ring itself has a melting point around 100°C due to the presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
